Several parents have asked about information regarding our remote learning option mentioned in our 2020-2021 Reopening Plan. We wanted to provide some additional context for parents to better make their decision.

If a family chooses to enroll in the BCS remote learning option, students will receive instruction from a BCS teacher via Zoom during specified times throughout the week. In addition, students will complete activities and assessments that will primarily come from BCS curriculum, supplemented with additional instructional resources. A typical day for a virtual student could include brief Zoom sessions with a BCS teacher, independently reading a novel or short story, constructing written responses, working math problems, and/or participating in a fine arts lesson. Just as traditional school days vary, so will the structure of virtual days. A more detailed plan for virtual learning will be released as soon as enrollment numbers are confirmed.

Mrs. Bryson holds a Master’s degree in Educational Leadership from the University of Mississippi and has been serving as an Assistant Principal at Bon Lin Middle School since 2014. With over twenty-five years of experience in the field of education, Mrs. Bryson has acquired extensive knowledge and skills while serving as a middle school teacher and as an Assistant Principal. Within Mrs. Bryson’s educational endeavors, she has served as a Title 1 Administrator, Testing Coordinator, State Reporting Administrator, and Master Scheduling Administrator. The combination of Mrs. Bryson’s education, training, and work experiences has greatly contributed to the preparation for this position.

To read the full release, click the link here:

- New Gym: by the start of new school year
- Field House: by the start of the new school year

We appreciate the flexibility of our students, families, faculty, and community during this process. Together, we will have a high school we can all be proud of for many years.

Built for Bartlett
August 1, 2019 at 5:40 PM ·

The renovation work on the campus of Bartlett High School continues to stay on schedule and remains ready for the start of school on August 12.

We have completed several aspects of the renovations including the Career Technical Education building, turf football field and practice field, curb and paving along the front drive, an expanded student and teacher parking- with approximately 400 parking spaces at this time. We are also completing work to the offices inside the Main building with flooring and carpeting already installed. This week, work continues on the Main building, various building connectors, fine arts wing, cafeteria, auditorium, as well as other building façade improvements.

We are excited to be able to update this school and address the needs of our students and faculty, as well as provide our community with a campus we can all take pride in. We will continue to provide additional updates leading up to the start of school. We look forward to seeing everyone on August 12 as we start our new school year!

Built for Bartlett
July 19, 2019 at 5:08 PM ·

If you haven’t seen the Bartlett High School campus lately, we have made tremendous progress over the summer. Our renovation plans continue to stay on track, and we are scheduled to start school on August 12 with buildings being completed in phases. Our Superintendent and Operations staff continue to meet daily to ensure the project stays on track, and we are excited to share all of our progress to date.

This week, work continues on the Main building connector as well as the Attendance and Guidance areas in the Main building. Work is also being completed on the West building connector, the front drives along Woodlawn, and our auto shop. Our machining equipment has found a new home, and the new Career Technical Education building (far east end of campus) is ready to welcome students when they return.

We will provide additional updates in the coming weeks leading up to the start of school. We look forward to seeing everyone on August 12th as we start our 2019-2020 school year.

shared_text:
Emily Newsom Cook‎Bartlett High School Band Alumni & Fans Page
May 23, 2019 at 4:09 PM ·

David Koger, a 2019 graduate of Bartlett High School, has been selected as a member of the Music City Drum and Bugle Corps. The Music City Drum and Bugle Corps is a World Class competitive junior drum and bugle corps. Based in Nashville, Tennessee, Music City is a member corps of Drum Corps International (DCI). David will be playing drum set for Music City’s two-month, twenty-four city United States tour. This tour will include a July 13th stop at the Liberty Bowl for DCI Memphis. The final stop of the tour will be in Indianapolis, Indiana at the DCI World Championships. David reports to Nashville on May 26th.

David was a percussionist in the Bartlett High School Band for four years. He plans to attend Middle Tennessee State University in the fall to pursue a degree in Jazz Studies. While at MTSU, David hopes to teach private percussion lessons and be a marching band percussion instructor for a local high school. David is the first Bartlett High School student to be selected as a member of a DCI group since 2003.
